info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 29 at 1:40AM PST until December 29 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...In California, Western Siskiyou County. This includes Klamath River, Happy Camp, Fort Jones and Etna. In Oregon, Central Douglas County, Eastern Curry County and Josephine County and Jackson County. This includes Medford, Central Point, Ashland, Talent, Jacksonville, Ruch, and passes on I-5 north of Grants Pass. It also includes portions of Highway 199 between Grants Pass and Obrien. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and icy road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...We now think snow will impact elevations down to valley floors. Snow impacts will gradually subside from north to south later this morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
